content.value: Disk and file system management in Linux involves checking disk usage, understanding storage devices, and mounting or unmounting file systems.
content.example: Example: Checking free disk space using the df command.

content.value: Linux systems rely on disks to store operating system files, applications, and user data. If a disk becomes full, the system may slow down or stop working correctly.

items: ntfs – Windows file system (supported in Linux)

content.value: df (disk free) is a command used to display available and used disk space on file systems.
content.example: Example: Checking how much disk space is left.

content.value: du (disk usage) is a command used to check the size of files and directories.
content.example: Example: Finding which directory uses the most space.
